caption:
This photograph presents an aerial view of an industrial site, potentially a mining operation. The image captures expansive pools of wastewater or chemical byproducts, characterized by their stark, shiny white and darker muddy colors. These pools are separated by earthen dams or embankments, forming a geometric landscape of artificial containment. 

To the right of the photo, industrial infrastructure, including buildings and possibly conveyor belt systems, can be observed, indicating active industrial operations are taking place. Smoke or steam plumes are visible in the distance, rising from parts of the facility, suggesting ongoing production processes.

The backdrop features a more natural landscape, with a body of water that could be a lake or river, and tree-covered hills. The sky is overcast, casting a soft light over the scene, which blurs the distinction between the industrial operations and the natural environment.

Overall, the composition juxtaposes the industrial activity against the natural elements surrounding it, highlighting the environmental impact of such facilities. This scene could be discussed in terms of environmental management, industrial activities, or the extraction of natural resources.
title: Reserve mining company's dump site on lake superior.  Foul smelling steam rises from the mucky water.  Reserve's taconite plant at silver bay produces iron ore from the taconite rock.  It discharges 67,000 tons of waste rock into the lake, daily
